sen.j: 建久七年の政変（けんきゅうしちねんのせいへん）とは、建久7年（1196年）に起きた政変。
sen.e: Coup of the seventh year of Kenkyu is a coup that took place in 1196.
Coup of the seventh year of Kenkyu was a coup that took place in 1196.
sen.cmt: 「a coup」間の全角ｽﾍﾟｰｽを半角ｽﾍﾟｰｽに修正しました。文法を修正しました。is→was
sen.e: Coup of the seventh year of Kenkyu was a coup that took place in 1196.

sen.j: 源頼朝は親幕派の九条兼実を朝廷での代弁者としていたが、娘の大姫 (源頼朝の娘)の後鳥羽天皇への入内に際し、既に院に九条任子を入内させていた九条兼実ではなく反兼実派で反幕派でもある源通親に相談した。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yoritomo had Kanezane KUJO as his spokesman at the Imperial Court, however, at the time of his daugher Ohime's judai (an Imperial Consort's bridal entry into court) for the Emperor Gotoba, he consulted MINAMOTO no Michichika, who wass anti-Kanezane and even anti-bakufu, and not Kanezane.

sen.j: 建久6年（1195年）、任子が天皇の皇女・昇子内親王を、通親の養子・源在子が為仁親王（のちの土御門天皇）を生んだ。
sen.e: In 1195, Nishi gave birth to Imperial Princess Shoshi, the emperor's daughter and MINAMOTO no Zaishi, Michichika's daughter, gave birth to Imperial Prince Tamehito (later called the Emperor Tsuchimikado).

sen.j: 翌建久7年（1196年）の11月23日に中宮九条任子が後宮から退去させられ、同月25日関白九条兼実が罷免され、近衛基通が関白に、頼朝の妹・坊門姫を母とする一条高能が参議に、坊門姫の娘を妻とする西園寺公経が蔵人頭にそれぞれ任じられ、同月26日に天台座主慈円が籠居を命じられ、太政大臣藤原兼房 (太政大臣)も更迭された（慈円・兼房はともに兼実の同母弟）。
sen.e: On November 23, 1196, chugu (Palace of the Empress) Ninshi KUJO was expelled from kokyu (empress's residence) and on the 25th of the same month, kanpaku Kanezane KUJO was dismissed and was replaced by Motomichi KONOE; Takayosho ICHIJO, whose mother was the sister of Yoritomo, Bomon hime, was appointed as sangi, Kintsune SAIONJI, the husband of Bomon hime's daughter, was appointed as Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain), and on the 26th of the same month, Jien, the head priest of the Tendai sect of Buddhism, was ordered to stay inside the residence, and FUJIWARA no Kanefusa, the Grand Minister, was reshuffled (both Jien and Kanefusa were both Kanezane's younger brother-uterine).

sen.j: 首謀者は、反兼実派の土御門通親と丹後局である。
sen.e: The ringleader were Michichika TSUCHIMIKADO and Tango no tsubone, anti-Kanezane.

sen.j: 二人は、後白河天皇の近臣であった。
sen.e: They were both Emperor Goshirakawa's trused vassals.

sen.j: つまり、頼朝に協力する気は元々なかったのではないかともいわれる。
sen.e: It is also said that they did not intend to cooperate Yoritomo.

sen.j: 一説に頼朝はこの策を聞かされても黙認していたという。
sen.e: According to a theory, Yoritomo remained silence even after hearing this plan.

sen.j: 結果としては、大姫は翌年の建久8年（1197年）、入内計画が本格化する前に死去。
sen.e: As a result, Ohime died a year later in 1197, before the plan of judai was put into practice.

sen.j: 翌年には一条高能も病死し、頼朝は朝廷での代弁者を失う形となったまま正治元年（1199年）に死去。
sen.e: In the following year, Takayoshi ICHIJO died of illness and Yoritomo died in 1199 without getting a spokesman in the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 土御門通親は実権を握るが、正治2年（1200年）、倒したはずの九条家の嫡男内大臣九条良経が左大臣に任じられ復活し、通親は建仁2年（1202年）死去。
sen.e: Michichika TSUCHIMIKADO gained the real power, however, in 1200, Yoshitsune KUJO, the legitimate son of the Kujo family, who he thought had defeated, came back to power as Sadaijin (minister of the left), which he was appointed; Michichika, on the other hand, died in 1202.

sen.j: 通親の死の2ヵ月後、九条良経は摂政太政大臣に任じられた。
sen.e: Two months after the death of Michichika, Yoshitaune KUJO was appointed as Sessho Daijo daijin (Regent and the Grand Minister).
